nodes.name: case
nodes.description: The collection of all data related to a specific patient or case in the context of a specific dataset or experiment.

properties.name: age_at_index
properties.description: The study participant's age, in years, at the index event. The index event is determined by the data submitter and used as an anchor date for all temporal variables. Note that an age of 0 indicates a participant who is younger than 1 year old. For participants with ages greater than 89 years, please use the property 'age_at_index_gt89'. This property is included to ensure personal privacy protection in accordance with the HIPAA Safe Harbor Method. More information can be found here https://www.hhs.gov/hipaa/for-professionals/special-topics/de-identification/index.html.

properties.name: age_at_index_gt89
properties.description: Indicates whether the subject's age at the time of the study was greater than 89 years. This property is included to ensure personal privacy protection in accordance with the HIPAA Safe Harbor Method. More information can be found here https://www.hhs.gov/hipaa/for-professionals/special-topics/de-identification/index.html.

properties.name: country_of_residence
properties.description: The country where the subject resides.

properties.name: covid19_positive
properties.description: An indicator of whether the patient has ever had a positive COVID-19 test or been diagnosed with one of the following ICD-10 COVID-19 conditions: COVID-19 (U07. 1), Influenza due to unidentified influenza virus with other manifestations (J11.8), Post COVID-19 condition (U09.9), Myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (G93.32), or Sequelae of other specified infectious and parasitic diseases (B94.8). For more information about a patient's specific COVID-19 diagnosis, details can be found under Condition.

properties.name: ethnicity
properties.description: A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition that is maintained from generation to generation. Members share a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group. They have similar and distinctive features in their lifestyle habits and shared experiences. They often have a common genetic heritage which may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.

properties.name: gen3_linked_subjects_available
properties.description: Indicates whether there is data available for the subject in other data resources.

properties.name: icu_indicator
properties.description: Indicates whether the subject has been admitted to the ICU.

properties.name: index_event
properties.description: The event used as the anchor or start date for all temporal data elements. This acts as day 0 on a timeline of events relating to the patient. This property is included to ensure personal privacy protection in accordance with the HIPAA Safe Harbor Method. More information can be found here https://www.hhs.gov/hipaa/for-professionals/special-topics/de-identification/index.html.

properties.name: linked_external_data
properties.description: A list of all external data resources that are confirmed to have data for the case.

properties.name: long_covid_diagnosis
properties.description: An indicator of whether the patient has ever been diagnosed with one of the following ICD-10 long COVID-19 conditions: U09.9 (Post COVID-19 condition, unspecified), G93.32 (Myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome), and B94.8 (Sequelae of other specified infectious and parasitic diseases). 'Positive' means the patient was diagnosed with a long COVID condition, while 'Not Reported' means the patient has never been diagnosed with a long COVID condition.

properties.name: race
properties.description: A geographic ancestral origin category that is assigned to a population group based mainly on physical characteristics that are thought to be distinct and inherent.

properties.name: sex
properties.description: The biologic character or quality that distinguishes male and female from one another as expressed by analysis of the person's gonadal, morphologic (internal and external), chromosomal, and hormonal characteristics.

properties.name: site_id
properties.description: A de-identified code used to classify a case as part of a specific data submission.

properties.name: treatment_info
properties.description: Indicates whether detailed treatment information is available for the subject.

properties.name: ventilator_indicator
properties.description: Indicates whether the subject has been on a ventilator.

properties.name: zip
properties.description: The three-digit United States zip code of residence for any population greater than 20,000. For zip codes where the three digit number represents a population less than 20,000 "000" will be provided.

properties.description: The code for a specific condition, assigned by the code system.

properties.name: condition_code_system
properties.description: The system that assigned the code for a specific condition.

properties.name: condition_name
properties.description: The name of the condition the patient has experienced.

properties.name: days_to_condition_end
properties.description: The number of days from the index date to the date the subject no longer experienced the condition. This property is included to ensure personal privacy protection in accordance with the HIPAA Safe Harbor Method. More information can be found here https://www.hhs.gov/hipaa/for-professionals/special-topics/de-identification/index.html.

properties.name: days_to_condition_start
properties.description: The number of days from the index date to the date the subject was diagnosed with or began experiencing the condition. This property is included to ensure personal privacy protection in accordance with the HIPAA Safe Harbor Method. More information can be found here https://www.hhs.gov/hipaa/for-professionals/special-topics/de-identification/index.html.

nodes.name: imaging_study
nodes.description: Information related to an imaging study or exam done for diagnostic or research purposes, including patient clinical or contextual data recorded at the time of the imaging study.

properties.name: age_at_imaging
properties.description: The study participant's age, in years, at the time the imaging study was performed. Note that an age of 0 indicates a participant who is younger than 1 year old. For participants with ages greater than 89 years, please use the property 'age_at_index_gt89'.

properties.name: age_at_imaging_gt89
properties.description: Indicates whether the age of the patient in years at the time the imaging study was performed is greater than 89 years. This property is included to ensure personal privacy protection in accordance with the HIPAA Safe Harbor Method. More information can be found here https://www.hhs.gov/hipaa/for-professionals/special-topics/de-identification/index.html.

properties.name: body_part_examined
properties.description: (0018, 0015) Body Part Examined. The Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) standard is the international standard to transmit, store, retrieve, print, process, and display medical imaging information.

properties.name: days_from_study_to_neg_covid_test
properties.description: The number of days from the imaging study to the patient's negative COVID-19 test(s).  This property takes a list of values, each of which represents a COVID-19 test for the patient. A positive value for this property means that a negative COVID-19 test result was obtained for the patient that many days after the imaging study was performed. A negative value indicates that a negative COVID-19 test result was obtained prior to the date of imaging. This property is included to ensure personal privacy protection in accordance with the HIPAA Safe Harbor Method. More information can be found here https://www.hhs.gov/hipaa/for-professionals/special-topics/de-identification/index.html.

properties.name: days_from_study_to_pos_covid_test
properties.description: The number of days from the imaging study to the patient's positive COVID-19 test(s).  This property takes a list of values, each of which represents a COVID-19 test for the patient. A positive value for this property means that a positive COVID-19 test result was obtained for the patient that many days after the imaging study was performed. A negative value indicates that the positive COVID-19 test result was obtained prior to the date of imaging. This property is included to ensure personal privacy protection in accordance with the HIPAA Safe Harbor Method. More information can be found here https://www.hhs.gov/hipaa/for-professionals/special-topics/de-identification/index.html.

properties.name: days_to_study
properties.description: The number of days between the case's index date and the date of the imaging study. This property is included to ensure personal privacy protection in accordance with the HIPAA Safe Harbor Method. More information can be found here https://www.hhs.gov/hipaa/for-professionals/special-topics/de-identification/index.html.

properties.name: annotation_method

nodes.name: annotation
nodes.description: Information describing characteristics of imaging studies, series and instances (e.g., segmentations, bounding boxes, feature labels) and inferences based on those characteristics (e.g., predicted diagnoses). Annotations may be recorded in the course of clinical care or retrospectively for purposes of research (e.g., imaging annotations from PACS or retrospective labeling tools). Please refer to https://midrc.org/annotations to learn more about a particular batch of annotations.

properties.name: airspace_disease_grading
properties.description: Values are extracted from the annotation file midrc_mdai_chestxr. Accepted values are "mild" opacities (1-2 lung zones), "moderate" opacities (3-4 lung zones), and "severe" opacities (>4 lung zones).

properties.name: annotation_long_name
properties.description: The long name of the annotation provides more information about the specific annotation.

properties.name: annotation_method

Clinically_derived - Based on information produced in the process of the subject's medical care; Retrospective_expert - Based on information produced retrospective to the subject's care by annotators with relevant special clinical expertise; Retrospective_general - Based on information produced retrospective to the subject's care by annotators without relevant special clinical expertise; Retrospective_auto - Based on information produced retrospective to the subject's care using automated means.

properties.name: annotation_name

properties.name: class_covid19_pneumonia
properties.description: Values are extracted from the annotation file midrc_mdai_chestxr; Accepted values include "typical" appearance, which is multifocal bilateral, peripheral opacities, or opacities with rounded morphology, lower lung-predominant distribution;  "indeterminate" appearance, which is absence of typical findings and unilateral, central or upper lung predominant distribution of airspace disease; "atypical" appearance, which is pneumothorax or pleural effusion, pulmonary edema, lobar consolidation, solitary lung nodule, or mass diffuse tiny nodules cavity; "negative" for pneumonia, which is no lung opacities.

properties.name: instance_uids

properties.name: midrc_mRALE_score
properties.description: Values are extracted from the annotation file mRALE_Mastermind_Challenge. The Radiographic Assessment of Lung Edema (RALE) score is provided as a reference standard assessment of disease severity on chest radiograph.  A normal chest radiograph receives a score of 0, while a chest radiograph with complete consolidation of both lungs receives the maximum score of 24.
